titleStmt.title: A copie of verses, said to be composed by his Majestie, upon his first imprisonment in the Isle of Wight
titleStmt.author: Brome, Alexander, 1620-1666.
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649, attributed name.

notesStmt.note: Not in fact by King Charles I, but a satire by Alexander Brome. Cf. Wing (2nd ed., 1994).
Verse -- "Imprison me ye traytors! Must I be".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
